main event: Three bright objects, described as car headlights a block or two away, were observed moving in the sky over Granby, Quebec, Canada on October 14, 1962.
interesting points: The objects moved in an elliptical motion and disappeared into the clouds at 45-degree intervals, with an estimated speed of 2,000 mph.
The objects appeared solid and white, and were considerably brighter than the background sky.
The observer noticed green lights at 15-second intervals between the three associated flight paths.
The observer had previously seen a UFO sighting years ago that involved a rapidly rising and disappearing object.
The report was forwarded to the Foreign Technology Division at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base in Ohio for further investigation.
sighted object: three bright, solid white objects moving in an elliptical pattern
